radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix is enlarged measuring 1.2 cm in maximum diameter with hyperemic and thickened appendiceal wall and significant surrounding fat stranding. Phlegmonous changes with small fluid collections suggestive of appendiceal perforation with developing abscesses versus phlegmon. Lower chest is within normal limits; no pleural or pericardial effusion. All other abdominal and pelvic organs are within normal limits, except for prominent ileocecal lymph nodes likely reactive.
